security_audit.summary: This is a documentation quality assurance skill that validates Jupyter notebooks. The Python script reads notebooks, runs style checks, and writes temporary markdown files. All capabilities align with its stated purpose of notebook auditing. No network calls, credential access, or suspicious behaviors detected.

content.value_statement: Cookbook contributors need consistent quality standards across all notebooks. This skill provides a comprehensive rubric and automated validation to ensure every Cookbook meets style guidelines, has proper structure, and delivers clear value to readers.
actual_capabilities: Run automated notebook validation checks for common issues
Detect hardcoded API keys and secrets using detect-secrets
Convert notebooks to markdown for easier review
Check for proper introduction, conclusion, and code explanations
Verify model constants and deprecated API patterns
Score notebooks across narrative, code, and technical dimensions
limitations: Does not execute notebook code to verify functionality
Automated checks cannot assess content quality or pedagogical effectiveness
Cannot validate external API responses or integration functionality
Requires manual review for subjective quality assessment

use_cases.title: Pre-submission review
use_cases.description: Validate notebooks before contributing to ensure they meet Cookbook standards.

use_cases.title: PR review process
use_cases.description: Streamline PR reviews by running automated checks and using consistent scoring rubrics.

use_cases.title: Style compliance check
use_cases.description: Check notebooks against style guidelines for proper structure and formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Basic notebook audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit the notebook at [path/to/notebook.ipynb] using the cookbook-audit skill. Run the validation script and provide a detailed review against the style guide.

prompt_templates.title: Quick validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run automated validation on [notebook.ipynb] using the cookbook-audit skill. Report any critical issues or warnings found.

prompt_templates.title: Full quality review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete audit of [notebook.ipynb]. Convert to markdown, run detect-secrets, and score each dimension: narrative quality, code quality, technical accuracy, and actionability.

prompt_templates.title: Template compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if [notebook.ipynb] follows the Cookbook style guide. Verify introduction structure, prerequisites, setup patterns, learning objectives, and conclusion mapping.

output: - Contains potential hardcoded secrets (see details below)
- No conclusion or summary section found
- Model name should be defined as a constant at the top

best_practices: Run the validation script before submitting any cookbook PR to catch issues early
Use the markdown output for detailed review as it provides cleaner context than raw notebooks
Combine automated checks with manual review for content quality and pedagogical effectiveness
Always check for hardcoded secrets as the first step in any review
anti_patterns: Submitting notebooks without running automated validation first
Ignoring warnings about missing explanations between code cells
Hardcoding model names throughout instead of using a constant at the top
Skipping the conclusion section that maps back to learning objectives

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It is designed for Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What notebook issues does it detect?
faq.answer: It checks for hardcoded secrets, missing introductions, verbose output, poor variable names, and deprecated models.

faq.question: How do I run the validation script?
faq.answer: Use the command: uv run validate_notebook.py <notebook.ipynb>. The script requires uv and nbconvert.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads notebook files and writes temporary markdown to a gitignored tmp/ directory.

faq.question: What if the script finds secrets?
faq.answer: The skill runs detect-secrets to flag potential hardcoded API keys. Review the output and remove any secrets before committing.

faq.question: Does it replace manual review?
faq.answer: No. Automated checks catch technical issues but cannot assess content quality, narrative flow, or pedagogical effectiveness.
